review: Dota is the single greatest video game of all time in my opinion but Valve has ruined it by refusing to update the game in any meaningful way. The only updates we get are AI slop updates that give minor tweaks to heroes like +5 move speed -1 armor or cosmetic slop patches like the most recent one. These patches are essentially humiliation rituals for Dota lifers. Valve is clearly more interested in making more shitty failure games like Artifact instead of allocating more resources into improving an already proven game and e-sport. League of legends has like 180 heroes and Dota only has about 120. Imagine if Valve never wasted any resources on total failure Artifact and dogshit Deadlock and just made more heroes and more frequent more interesting balance patches how great Dota could have become.

review:
There is nothing tidy about a great Dota match. It‚Äôs a plan written in pencil while the table shakes. You queue for one game before bed and somehow you‚Äôre counting Roshan minutes at two in the morning, telling yourself that one good smoke can still turn it.

My favorite memory isn‚Äôt a rampage or a rapier flip. It‚Äôs the quiet after we botched a mid fight, when our offlaner typed ‚Äúmy bad,‚Äù pinged a smoke, and cut through the triangle without another word. We wrapped around, took vision, found a single pick, and the whole map felt different. That‚Äôs the Dota I love: it breaks you down and then hands you the tools to rebuild if you keep your head.

The design feels honest in a way competitive games rarely do. Every advantage has a window you can actually spot. Every mistake leaves a footprint you can learn from. Neutral items nudge priorities without erasing identity. Buybacks are terrifying, but they are fair, and they create the best late game tension I‚Äôve ever felt. Patches don‚Äôt delete your knowledge; they make it evolve.

If you‚Äôre new and looking over the wall, you don‚Äôt need to know everything. Learn what vision does to a fight. Learn when a smoke is worth more than a stack. Mute fast when you need to. Pick a couple of heroes that make you curious and repeat them until your hands know what your eyes want. One day you‚Äôll pull the wave to reset equilibrium without thinking, and that tiny habit will feel better than any big number on a scoreboard.

To everyone at Valve, from artists to analysts to the people keeping servers breathing on patch night, thank you for treating a free game like a craft project. Dota still feels handcrafted even when it‚Äôs loud and messy. Replays, silhouettes you recognize at a glance, the quiet relief of a clean load-in, it all adds up. If there‚Äôs one wish, it‚Äôs this: keep investing in the first ten hours so more players hit that ‚ÄúI get it now‚Äù moment sooner, because once it lands, they aren‚Äôt leaving.

I recommend Dota 2 without hesitation. Not because it‚Äôs easy, but because it respects the time you give it. It will frustrate you, it will humble you, and then it will hand you a win that sends you to bed smiling at the ceiling. See you at nightfall, smoke ready, buybacks aligned, one good call away from a story worth telling.

review:
I've played League and Dota 2 for over 100 hours each and Dota 2 feels way more like a video game compared to the artificially made competitive "game" Riot has made. This feels like Warcraft 3 and those World of Warcraft heroes and monsters you can recognize. It's got that Valve humor and charm. Valve takes their time updating the game but when they do it's extremely innovative and changes the map when League is the most minor of changes.

Yes this game is EXTREMELY difficult but it's a really fun level of difficulty. There's so much to learn and if you come into this game just to try a video game out you will have so much fun. I played a lot of bot games when I started just because I really enjoyed getting to learn some heroes and the map and how mechanics work. It's a very mechanically intensive game but it's not like League where you have to hit your street fighter combo of skill shots to do damage, your hero is very overpowered but so is every hero! So it's really fun, you can feel like a raid boss sometimes. The sound design is incredible, the cosmetics are awesome, Cave JoHnson being an announcer pack makes me smile so much. I wish I can buy the Gaben one! 

This game truly deserves so many more players just because it's actually a really fun video game with a beautiful sandbox where so many new things can happen and any hero and strategy is viable if you put your mind to it and be creative. It's amazing with friends. Please note I have not played ranked yet as I am trying to play a game and win a game on every hero first but even in losses where I get stomped now I still find myself having so much fun. I strongly recommend this game as it is truly the best in the genre and requires you to be open to learning and be uncomfortable which is what life is all about.

review:
While I appreciate Valve effort to make the game Linux compatible, it is quite unstable given it is a competitive and old game. it crashed very often. then players try to reconnect. If you dont manage to reconnect within 5 min, Hell  boy, the game will make you pay for it. Prevents you for playing for 1 day, moves you to low priority matchmaking queues,  does not allow you to chat (even to plan an attack or anything) and only makes you play I kind of game where you hero is picked randomly. 
Most of the time, Steam will prevent the game from running after a crash and will make you wait 10-20 minutes to "download content". I still have no idea what that content is, but you can be sure that after being put into the low priority status, you wont be content for long. 
Overall, the game improves the mechanics of DOTA 1 and delivers fast dopamine, but the punitive system regarding the disconnections is unbearable given the constant crashes. Tried to climb out of the low priority queue, but it is impossible.  it is filled with trash players and the crashes made my situation worst. 
This game will make you frustrated and unhappy. STAY AWAY

review:
I've been playing dota for years, but honestly, this game has turned into a massive disappointment. It keeps crashing for no reason and its definitely not my PC‚Äôs fault. My specs can handle far heavier games smoothly, yet dota keeps freezing and crashing like it‚Äôs still in early beta access. Imagine losing mmr or wasting time because of poor optimization that‚Äôs never fixed.

I finally gave up and switched to Xbox and Battle.net to play FPS games and you know what? The experience is miles better. Even though steam has a lot of fps titles, I chose to leave it completely because steam and valve have become so unreliable. Their systems feel outdated, their games feel neglected, and the overall experience just isn‚Äôt worth it anymore.

What‚Äôs even worse is how dota‚Äôs integrity keeps falling apart. Even my long time dota friends have quit because the game feels unfair and broken. The matchmaking algorithm is a joke once you go on a win streak, the system suddenly matches you with impossible lineups just to ruin your momentum. It doesn‚Äôt matter if you play well or maintain good behavior the algorithm feels punishing instead of rewarding.

And to make things even more frustrating, valve can‚Äôt even properly handle account recovery issues. When someone else gets access to your account, you‚Äôll go through endless verification steps. Even if you already have solid evidence proving you‚Äôre the real owner, they‚Äôll keep demanding more and more details like they don‚Äôt even want to help you recover it. It‚Äôs a complete waste of time.

At this point, I‚Äôm done. This game sucks, and valve has completely lost its touch. The passion, fairness, and fun that once made dota great are gone. The company doesn‚Äôt listen, the support is terrible, and the quality keeps going downhill.

I‚Äôll never use steam or any valve game again. Dota‚Äôs legacy is fading fast, and Gen Z players don‚Äôt even care about it anymore. valve needs to wake up ‚Äî because the way things are going, dota is no longer a legend‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs just another forgotten game.

review:
Good game that will get you hooked, huge learning curve, LOTS of possible scenarios due to many heroes with many abilities and items. 

It's a team game, and the community isn't the best really, so don't be afraid of using the mute function with rude/ toxic players, and enjoy at ur pace! 
Still, I met some really amazing people with nice personalities and we party queue games whenever we are online..

I'd really love if valve released more content, events and bring back the battlepass!!

review:
Dota 2 is not a game.
Dota 2 is a life decision you will regret, recover from, miss, and then regret again.

You don‚Äôt play Dota 2.
Dota 2 plays you.
Your sleep schedule? Gone.
Your mental health? Negotiable.
Your friendships? Depends on whether someone last-picked Techies.

The graphics are nice, the heroes are unique, and the lore is deep‚Äî
BUT NONE OF THAT MATTERS
when your carry decides to farm jungle for 42 minutes because ‚Äúlate game we win‚Äù.

Every match feels like:

Minute 5: ‚ÄúWe got this guys.‚Äù

Minute 10: ‚ÄúMid feeding.‚Äù

Minute 15: ‚ÄúSupport no wards.‚Äù

Minute 20: ‚ÄúReport all.‚Äù

Minute 50: ‚ÄúGG go next.‚Äù

And somehow, even though you HATE THIS GAME, uninstall it, swear never to return,
Steam will still open by itself like:

‚ÄúHey. One game?‚Äù

And you will say yes.

Because you are weak.
Because Dota 2 owns your soul.
Because you believe in comeback mechanics that only exist in your imagination.

Rating: 10/10
Would ruin my life again.
name: Dota 2

review:
I recommend this game, but it is not for everyone. Dota 2 has many cons. There will be 40-60% of matches that are ranging from boring to dreadful, either due to smurfs, one sided games, someone disconnecting, someone throwing, getting counter-picked, and toxic/frustrated players who cannot handle that and will start flaming.

If you can endure through that, then there are games which are enjoyable, but where you may not have that much of an impact. The outcome of the match was really not decided based on your performance.

And then there will also be those 10% of intense games where every decision and action matters, and those absolutely makes it worth playing this game.
name: Dota 2

review:
I‚Äôve been playing Dota 2 for around ten years, and it‚Äôs honestly been a huge part of my gaming life. The game has always been about strategy, teamwork, and that feeling of satisfaction when a perfectly executed play turns the tide of a match. Over the years, I‚Äôve seen countless patches, reworks, new heroes, and meta shifts ‚Äî some great, some frustrating, but always keeping the game alive.

However, lately I‚Äôve found myself feeling‚Ä¶ tired. I‚Äôm not even sure why ‚Äî maybe it‚Äôs the constant patch changes that make the game feel unstable, or maybe I‚Äôve just lost that spark that kept me logging in every day. The excitement, the thrill of competition, somehow isn‚Äôt there anymore.

Don‚Äôt get me wrong ‚Äî Dota 2 is still one of the most complex and rewarding competitive games ever made. It has an amazing community, and the depth of its gameplay is unmatched. But after a decade, I think it‚Äôs time for me to take a break.

Maybe someday I‚Äôll return when that passion reignites. For now, though, I‚Äôll just say: thank you, Dota 2, for the memories.

Verdict:
‚≠ê 8/10 ‚Äî A legendary game that defined a generation of players. But even legends can lose their magic after too long on the battlefield.

review: Dota 2 is a more action packed version of dota.  It is very steep and rewards a killer instinct which is best played out here.  Because of the large number of options, finding solutions is an important skill in games although managing the psychology of stress and team dynamics are just as important.  The complexity built up over years of development and continuous balancing and a meta which shifts from tournament to tournament makes it a hard game to keep up with.

review:
New player experience is dreadful. Get matched against players with 3K matches when this is your first MOBA you try to learn. Get railed by Invisibility, Illusions, until it becomes Troll Warlord with tons of lifesteal, Bloodseeker's Rupture, Clinkz using Invisibility and Illusions, etc. But then you play Riki, or see Storm Spirit dashing around, and you go positive once after losing 13 games and there's this little light that beckons, I want to know more.
Menus are really good, a lot better than League of Legends, but all of them need to accept language like "anti-lifesteal" or "anti-invisibility" to recommend tools to counter problems for beginners. I want more tags in the hero menu like Splash, Silence, etc!

review: If you are worried about your mental health, I gotta warn ya, dota 2 community is toxic as HELL and Valve made it super easy for these toxic people to report you "for no reason at all".. yeah that's right. each player gets to report another, 6 times in each match. and it does not end at this point. admins who ban ya also dont know anything about roles. For example if pick a sup and the carry is too dumb to make the game a win, you CAN NOT act like a boss and stand up for kills. You gotta just move behind the dumbest core ever till enemy finishes the game in 60 mins. That is what this game has transformed to. A pool of toxicity that when you show creativity, they just throw you to LOW priority. NOW, what is low priority you may ask? Its a match unlike what you installed on your computer. in fact you kinda get to play another game. with only 3 heroes. its a game of chances that this toxic community LOOOOOVEEEES. I've been playing since dota 1. so more than your age probably. I recommend that you don't install this game until they fix the Behavior Score policy. it just ruins your day when you are super niceee and super creative and then coming back to your PC to play a game in which you payed $2000 of skins, and NOPE you can not play this game. you gotta play Single draft with the most stupid players on the surface of this planet till you win 5 matches. and you wont win for like 10 or 12 matches which takes 5 days of a normal human with a JOB ^_^ yeahh. Also the ranking system is super stupid. you just cant win a 1 v 9 game when you get the worst team mates who think of nothing but ruining your experience and revenge on "why did you tell me to buy wards?". as Gaben said, he does not care about our feedback. He just does what he wants to.

review:
I learned to love Dota 2 by playing support at 2 AM, buying wards I swore I couldn‚Äôt afford, and watching a hopeless lane become winnable because the map finally made sense. This game is a long conversation with your past self. Yesterday you overextended for one more range creep. Today you drag the wave, plant a sentry on instinct, and live to tell the story.

The magic is how cause and effect stay visible. Win a fight near an objective and the whole river tilts in your favor. Lose a fight with buybacks down and you can feel the punishment in your bones. Patches change the surface, but the logic underneath remains readable. If you pay attention, Dota forgives slower than most games, and teaches faster than you expect.

People joke that nothing feels better than a rampage, but my favorite moments are quieter. A smoke that threads the needle between two wards. A carry who trusts a risky call because you pinged it with confidence. A glimpse of a courier path that gives away an ancient stack. These are tiny, human victories that never show up on the scoreboard and somehow matter most.

If you are new, you do not need encyclopedic knowledge. Learn why vision wins fights. Learn that it is okay to trade farm for tempo. Mute early when needed and keep the chat wheel for jokes, not judgment. Pick two or three heroes that make you curious and keep them until your hands know the buttons before your brain does. There is a day when you stop panicking at the minimap and start reading it. That day changes everything.

To the folks at Valve, thank you for making a competitive game that still feels handcrafted. The silhouettes remain readable, the replays are a gift, and the client gets out of the way when it matters. If I could ask for anything, it would be richer first hour guidance and more guardrails around early social friction. The moment someone feels their first real swing of agency, they stay.

I recommend Dota 2 because it stays interesting in the small details long after the big ones are familiar. It is stubborn, brilliant, occasionally infuriating, and somehow the perfect place to spend a late night with four names you may never meet and a plan that might actually work. See you on the high ground.

review: I installed Dota 2 thinking it was a game. It‚Äôs not. It‚Äôs a federally approved psychological warfare simulator disguised as entertainment. My first match lasted 72 emotional years. Somewhere between getting flamed for buying boots and being called a ‚Äúwalking ward,‚Äù I felt my hair detach from my soul and leave my scalp. By the 30-minute mark, I had gray strands, hand tremors, and a newfound respect for war veterans. My carry told me to uninstall, my support told me to die, and the enemy Sniper shot me from another dimension just to remind me I was never safe. When it was finally over, I just sat there in silence, staring into the void, wondering if I‚Äôd ever feel joy again. 11/10, would suffer again.

review:
This game became toxic to it's core. Every social functionality they added (hero chat, wave, etc.) pours gasoline over already toxic moba playerbase. You can't play with the people that knows the same language. They brought this "Dota Plus" which is just idiotic. They want you to pay them on monthly basis to play the game better?! You need to pay to see the in depth stats to become a better player. Becoming a better player  = investing into the game. So they don't want people to play their games. just utterly idiotic. 

If you want to have quick fun (aka turbo game that ends in around 30 min) you can't. People with different levels will be there. People that will disconnect in 2 mins after the game starts will be there. People that have no idea what a computer game is will be there. There's no logic to matchmaking.

PS: I started playing the game in 2012. It was toxic before. It is still toxic with extra functionality now. Thanks Valve. You are the best example of how a potentially good game can be a niche toxic sludge of a piece of software

review: As much as LoL players like to tout that their game is better, it really only is in terms of its ability to run on toasters, simplicity, or (maybe) its art style. For folks that enjoy a lot of complexity, Dota 2 has a steep curve, but honestly its a lot of fun. I enjoy the longer games, so long as its not a stomp, and I feel like the community is (generally) not toxic so long as you keep your behavior score up. Dota does a good job of dealing with cheaters and toxic people in my opinion.

review:
Dota 2 can be a black hole sucking every good emotion from you, at the same time it can make you feel like the king of the world. 

On a more serious note, this game will teach you patience, strategy/planning , the cost of mistakes, efficiency, mental fortitude etc. Dota 2 is definitely not for the weak minded. This game is not just a visual battlefield, it is MOST DEFINITELY an emotional battlefield. That's why I also think that the lessons you learn in this game, will also be useful irl for you. 

And to conclude, I feel like I still have a LOT to learn from this game, so that's how much complexity this game really has.

review:
Dota 2 is a masterpiece of competitive gaming ‚Äî a deep, complex, and endlessly rewarding experience. Every match feels unique, driven by its massive hero roster and limitless strategic possibilities. The learning curve can be steep, but once you grasp the mechanics, the satisfaction of pulling off perfect team fights or game-winning plays is unmatched.

The visuals are polished, the sound design is immersive, and Valve continues to support the game with frequent updates and events. Whether you‚Äôre playing casually with friends or climbing the ranked ladder, Dota 2 offers intense, unforgettable moments that few games can match.

Verdict: A must-play for anyone who loves strategy, teamwork, and high-stakes competition. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

review:
This game is not for the faint of heart, the young, or the weak-willed. Dota will break you down, then build you up into an entirely different person; and it will do so not through affirmation, communication, or good constructive criticism, but through anguish, pain, and misery.

It is a mountain taller than Mount Everest, steeper than Mount Thor. You will climb alongside, or against billions of other people in a slow, grueling race towards the peak. 

Some choose to stay at the base of the mountain, akin to guardsman testing each and every new climber with skills they have yet to learn, a third of the way to the top. If they don't have what it takes, they'll be stuck at the base and not make any progress. Some will inevitably break and concede, others stubbornly climb back up not knowing what they did wrong, and very few who persisted and passed through into Crusader and beyond.

I say this as an eighteen year old with possible ADHD, do not play this game if you care about your self-esteem and overall physical and mental health. It will waste your life away like an illegal substance.

Herald & Guardian deserve their own special layers in hell. They are filled to the brim with [R-word], [R-word], Narcissists, people who have conditions similar to mine, and more. Live a life that's worth more than wasting five hours a day furiously typing in chat why your offlaner picked Rikimaru, why someone didn't set up vision, or someone delaying the game to sixty minutes despite our team having the necessary equipment and skills to being this close to grasping victory.

I reiterate, do not play this game if you care about your mental and physical well-being.

review:
It‚Äôs becoming incredibly frustrating how many smurf accounts there are in Dota. Out of ten matches, at least seven have a smurf either on your team or the enemy‚Äôs. If you get three games without one, you‚Äôre actually lucky.

I honestly don‚Äôt know what can be done to fix this, but the current ranking system is slowly killing the joy of playing. There‚Äôs no real sense of fair competition anymore ‚Äî you constantly end up facing Immortal or Divine-level players while you‚Äôre supposed to be in Archon ranks. These smurfs dominate every game with unreal scores, making it impossible to enjoy or improve naturally.

Valve really needs to introduce a better ranking system and stronger IP or account verification methods to reduce smurfing.

review:
[h1] Score: 9.4/10 A Rewarding and Uncompromising Competitive Masterpiece [/h1]

[b]Dota 2[/b] is a strategic well without a bottom. With over 100 [b]free-to-play[/b] Heroes, every match is a peerless tactical puzzle, demanding flawless mastery of items, timing, and team coordination. It stands as the pinnacle of [b]MOBA[/b] game design.

Valve‚Äôs [b]Free-to-Play[/b] model is exceptionally generous; victory is purely skill-based, not wallet-based. While the client is polished and the character designs are vibrant, Dota 2 has a [b]brutally steep learning curve[/b] and a community that can be unforgiving. This game will drown newcomers before they learn to swim.

However, if you persevere, the reward of executing a perfect strategy and watching the enemy Ancient crumble is [/b]one of the most satisfying moments in all of gaming.[/b] This isn't just a game; it's an obsession that will last hundreds, if not thousands, of hours.

review:
Recommended üëç
Hours Played: Too many to admit publicly

Dota 2 is the most intense emotional rollercoaster you can experience while sitting perfectly still. One minute you're a godlike tactician leading your team to glorious victory ‚Äî the next, you‚Äôre questioning every life choice that led you to queue ‚Äújust one more game.‚Äù

The gameplay? Addictive. The dopamine hits? Astronomical. The community? ‚Ä¶Let‚Äôs call it ‚Äúpassionately diverse.‚Äù You‚Äôll meet both strategic geniuses and people who make you reconsider free will. But that‚Äôs part of the charm ‚Äî like being yelled at by a teammate you‚Äôll never meet again, yet somehow still remember five years later.

Despite the occasional toxicity and the existential dread of watching your Ancient crumble, nothing quite matches the thrill of landing that perfect combo or pulling off a miraculous comeback.

Play Dota 2.
Lose your sanity.
Gain enlightenment.
Repeat.

review:
Dota 2 is a giant, living puzzle. Every match asks you to read the draft, map, timings, and items, and then make five people row in the same direction. The high points are unmatched: a perfectly timed smoke, a clutch buyback into Roshan, or a base defense that flips the game in thirty seconds. Frequent patches keep the meta fresh without deleting everything you learned.

The price of entry is real. The tutorial barely scratches the surface, solo queue can be unforgiving, and the information firehose hits you before you‚Äôve built the mental models to parse it. Long matches also mean every mistake has time to snowball.

Form a small group, pick a few comfort heroes, and commit to communication, and Dota becomes endlessly rewarding. If you need quick wins and short sessions, this may test your patience more than your mechanics.

review:
My dad left our family.
There were no screams, no conversations ‚Äî only silence and the sound of the closing door.
When I was little, he used to play Dota all the time. I remembered those sounds ‚Äî the music, the heroes‚Äô voices ‚Äî as if they were a part of my childhood. Sometimes he laughed, sometimes he got angry, sometimes he just sat there, staring at the screen, as if everything else stopped existing. He ignored everyone and everything.
Then he left.
Now he plays LoL, and I rarely talk to him.

At first, I just wanted to understand what drew him in so much, why he liked to come home from work and play. But the more I played, the more I realized that Dota is like life ‚Äî one of the greatest games ever. It has everything: joy, anger, friendship, resentment, gratitude. People here are very different.

Sometimes you meet those who shout, insult, and blame everyone around them ‚Äî as if they‚Äôre venting all the pain from everything that went wrong in their lives. They get mad at you for not building something, for a misplaced ward, or for not dying in a fight. But that‚Äôs not the main downside of Dota. Sometimes you meet completely different people ‚Äî kind, calm, grateful. Someone just says, ‚ÄúThanks for stacking,‚Äù or ‚ÄúNice play,‚Äù and those words warm your heart more than a whole victory.

The more I play, the more I see ‚Äî Dota isn‚Äôt only about fights. It‚Äôs about people ‚Äî kind and angry, grateful and not, reasonable and unreasonable. It‚Äôs about what‚Äôs inside us. Sometimes it‚Äôs not skill or gameplay that matters, but what‚Äôs within you. The game depends on people and what kind of atmosphere they create.
If everyone‚Äôs kind, understanding, ready to help or give advice ‚Äî if there‚Äôs good communication ‚Äî you already have a chance to win. With such people, even breathing feels easier. They laugh even when things go badly. They try to joke, to relax. They remind you that it‚Äôs just a game ‚Äî and that maybe life, too, can someday become easier.
And when I hear ‚ÄúThanks for the game,‚Äù something clicks inside me. Because maybe that‚Äôs what I‚Äôve always been waiting for ‚Äî a simple ‚Äúthank you.‚Äù Something my dad never said.

Thanks to Dota, I got closer to someone I love and cherish deeply. We played together, laughed together ‚Äî he always taught me mechanics. With every game, he came closer.
At first, we were just in a party, just playing. Then it became a habit, a warmth we can‚Äôt live without now. Every day, we spend time together, play Dota together. He showed me that even after pain, you can trust again, smile again, live again.
Thanks to Dota, I didn‚Äôt just find myself ‚Äî I found him.
And now, every time I enter the game, I know that among all those players, there‚Äôs one person who makes my life meaningful.
The one I treasure.
The one I love.

Good game! Even though some people say, ‚ÄúDota players are toxic, mean, inadequate,‚Äù that‚Äôs not true. Not all are like that. Nothing is one-sided ‚Äî because in each of us, there‚Äôs both light and darkness. You can‚Äôt live only in light or only in shadow. The same goes for Dota players ‚Äî there are no purely bad or purely good ones. Good without a touch of evil is nothing. Evil without a spark of good is nothing, too.

And maybe that‚Äôs the real magic of Dota ‚Äî not in winning, but in seeing yourself in others.
Dota is like a mirror, where each time I see not just characters, teammates, or enemies ‚Äî but emotions, destinies, real people.

Sometimes, while playing, I catch myself thinking that these random teammates are reflections of people from real life.
The one who yells and blames everyone ‚Äî like my father, tired after work, lost, unable to say he‚Äôs hurting.
The one who jokes and supports ‚Äî like my mother, always ready to warm you even when she‚Äôs freezing herself.
And someone stays silent, just doing their job, helping without expecting anything back. And suddenly you realize how little it takes to make the world kinder ‚Äî just not to stay silent when someone falls. Just to say, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay, it‚Äôs not over, let‚Äôs play again.‚Äù

Sometimes I think Dota is like therapy.
You queue up again and again, get hurt, frustrated, desperate ‚Äî but somewhere deep inside, a small spark of hope appears. You learn to accept losses. You learn not to get angry at mistakes ‚Äî yours or others‚Äô. You learn to forgive. You learn to improve.

And the more you play, the more you realize ‚Äî Dota isn‚Äôt about kills, gold, or victory. It‚Äôs about character. About not giving up. About how from shouting comes silence, and from chaos comes understanding.
In the game, it‚Äôs simple: you either win, or you learn from your mistakes.
In life, it‚Äôs harder.

Thanks to Dota, I learned that closeness isn‚Äôt always words.
Sometimes it‚Äôs just silence in Discord while both of you farm creeps, hearing only the mouse and keyboard.
Sometimes it‚Äôs laughing together after a failed gank.
Sometimes it‚Äôs the feeling that someone beside you understands you without words ‚Äî someone who doesn‚Äôt judge, doesn‚Äôt demand, just is.

We didn‚Äôt just play, we lived small lives ‚Äî each match like a chapter.
There were moments we argued, wanted to mute each other, to leave. But we always came back ‚Äî because deep inside we knew: without that warmth, without that bond, there‚Äôs emptiness.

He became the one who showed me that trust is possible even after betrayal, that you can love not through pain, but through light.
When he said, ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs go next,‚Äù I heard more than about the game. I heard it about life.
And I went on.

Now, when I enter a match, I don‚Äôt look for victory.
I look for the atmosphere where I can breathe.
For those who‚Äôll say ‚Äúthank you,‚Äù for those who won‚Äôt leave in silence, for those who‚Äôll remind me I‚Äôm not alone.
Each match is like a tiny universe, and each person in it ‚Äî a star that can light your small path toward something bigger.

If even one person in the game can be kind, then maybe not all is lost in the world.
Because maybe that‚Äôs all we‚Äôre really looking for ‚Äî not victory, not recognition, but a simple human ‚Äúthank you.‚Äù

And when the match ends, and the screen says ‚ÄúVictory‚Äù or ‚ÄúDefeat,‚Äù I smile.
Because I understand ‚Äî it doesn‚Äôt matter. It‚Äôs just a game.
The main thing is that I played again, felt again, lived again.
And if life is like a big game of Dota, then I just want to play it honestly ‚Äî with heart, with those who are near, with those who remember that even in darkness, there‚Äôs always a place for light.
name: Dota 2

review: After 6000 hours, the game's balance is in the best state ever. Unfortunately, a couple of factors make the game unplayable. 1) Role tokens. These create so many non-games, where a player has selected a role they don't know how to play in order to earn role tokens to play one that they do. Longer queue times are a small price to pay for higher quality games. 2) Poor matchmaking on weekends. This would be fixed by increasing MMR volatility significantly after 3 days of absence to get players to their proper rank faster.

review:
F this game. It was perfect. The best game for people who will struggle to learn something hard and hold on so to perfect something never ending. The idea that someone could cheat to feel strong is beyond me - it's self-evidence of weakness. This game is not that, but those left are fighting to see who is the best with their cheats, finding out who they become. Seems a whole different world that what I remember ~ Acue and the rest. It's a real grieving experience, though long overdue and long after most. A run though, it was guys. 4212 hours total, learned MnK on this (six months of back and forth at 35, now 40). The game will always be a part of me. So many nights, so many convos, so many mistakes, so engrossed in something so engrossing. Everyone else I loved here has moved on. I'm gonna go see if I can find them. 

............... Just did the math. 69 months, start to finish - 4212 Hours on Origin and Steam. Letttts Goooo 
(to the chiropractor). I regret nothing. I don't think I have another FPS in me guys. I love what we had, never turned to the dark side, became better than I imagined possible. GGs my true ones, no matter what input. I'm a demon on controller too, after all. Apex was my first lol.

review:
Apex Legends is a great game ‚Äî I love the gunplay, I love the heroes, and it still delivers some of the best movement and shooting mechanics in any FPS.

It can get a bit repetitive at times, but that‚Äôs mostly because I‚Äôve played it so much. I really wish they‚Äôd bring back Arenas mode ‚Äî I‚Äôve been hoping for its return every season since it was removed. That said, Mixtape is a fun addition and scratches a bit of that same itch.

Overall, it‚Äôs a fast, fluid, and fun shooter that keeps me coming back even after all these seasons.

review:
This game is very special to me, my all-time favorite. Even when I get tired of playing it, I never truly get bored. I first started playing Apex Legends back in 2020 on my old laptop. Sadly, I had to stop because my laptop could no longer handle the game.

After three years, in 2025, I managed to save some money. One day, I saw a TikTok video of someone playing Apex, and it instantly brought back all the memories. That‚Äôs when I decided to buy a computer and start playing again. When I finally did, I was so happy it felt like I was reunited with something I truly loved.

But just recently, something unfortunate happened my account got permanently banned because I got into arguments and trash-talked other players. When that happened, I felt really sad and deeply regretted my actions. All my memories and rare weapon skins were gone, just like that.

Still, nothing can stop me. I created a new account and decided to begin my Apex Legends journey all over again. This time, I‚Äôll play with a better attitude and more respect toward others.

To everyone who struggles with anger issues, my advice is this: never release your anger in the game. You might end up like me banned for something that could have been avoided. Peace!

Lastly, I highly recommend Apex Legends to anyone who loves FPS games. It‚Äôs truly one of the best, most thrilling games you‚Äôll ever play. Once you start, you‚Äôll understand why it‚Äôs so special.

review: Sigh. What to say about this game. I've been playing this game since season 4 and I used to be obsessed with it. and I mean that literally, I lived, breathed and slept Apex. I would play it for 8-9 hours every single day for multiple seasons because I was so obsessed with it. There is no other game you'll find that has the type of gameplay that apex does and that's what makes it so addicting despite it's plentiful issues, especially lately. Which brings me to it's issues. Once covid hit, EA decided to take the reins of apex more than it ever had before and they laid off a lot of the devs that actually put their heart into the game. Now the game is one massive cash grab. It's so obvious to anyone that's played this game for a long time that the game has lost its whimsy and is only here to garner as much money from people as possible. Regardless, I still love the game more than anything and I'll, unfortunately, always come back.

review:
Apex Legends in 2025 remains a technically strong and mechanically satisfying battle royale. Players still praise its fast, fluid movement, tight gunplay, and the distinct personalities of its Legends. It continues to stand out for its dynamic combat and teamwork-focused gameplay, proving that its core design has aged remarkably well.

However, the community‚Äôs overall mood has shifted toward frustration. Many players criticize the current monetization model, calling it overly aggressive and out of touch with the fanbase. The battle pass changes, high-priced cosmetics, and frequent limited-time bundles have pushed even long-time players away. Matchmaking is another recurring issue, with many reporting uneven matches and a steep skill gap that makes solo play punishing.

While technical stability has improved ‚Äî with fewer major server issues and better hit registration ‚Äî the player base has noticeably declined, especially on Steam. This has led to longer queue times in some regions and less consistent lobbies.

Despite these problems, Apex Legends still delivers when everything clicks: fast-paced fights, smooth mechanics, and moments of teamwork that few games can match. It‚Äôs clear the core of Apex is still brilliant ‚Äî it‚Äôs just buried under decisions that many players feel have hurt the experience.

Verdict:
A once-great battle royale that still shines mechanically but is weighed down by heavy monetization and inconsistent matchmaking. A solid shooter at its core, but one that‚Äôs lost some of its spark in 2025.

review:
Apex Legends is hands-down one of the best battle royale experiences out there. The gameplay feels incredibly smooth, responsive, and satisfying, whether you‚Äôre sliding into combat or pulling off a clutch win with your squad. Each Legend brings something unique to the table, and the constant updates, new maps, and seasonal events keep the game feeling fresh and alive.

The teamwork aspect is where Apex really shines ‚Äî coordinating abilities, reviving teammates, and making split-second decisions gives every match its own story. The ping system is still one of the best in gaming, making communication easy even without a mic.

The visuals are stunning, the sound design is top-notch, and the movement system makes every moment feel fluid and fast-paced. Respawn continues to show dedication to improving the game with balance changes and community feedback.

Whether you‚Äôre a casual player or a competitive grinder, Apex Legends delivers excitement, intensity, and pure fun every single match. An absolute must-play!

review:
I've played the game since it's first release in 2019. The typical triple-gay woke agenda is out in the open with BLM, LGBT is in full swing. BlackRock using taxpayer dollars to fund these projects. I will never spend a single dime. They honestly have fixed absolutely nothing. The servers are still absolute garbage, game skins everywhere, pay to win nonsense. The cheating is still rampant. Nobody uses VOIP and the ones that do simply mute you because of their incel behavior.

I am currently level 300+ and won 10 victories at least 1 per hour. The grind and predatory microtransactions is unreal. You would need to play 300+ hours just to unlock a single Legend as a F2P. It's P2W due to the fact that certain Legends are locked behind a paywall and you would need to pay actual money to actually enjoy it and gain an advantage.

Respawn is definitely using bots ingame which explains why nobody voice chats or even chats at all. I had bots literally walking slowly towards me in the first 3 minutes of the match. I had a bot hiding in a corner only to shoot several warning shots at it. No reaction. No melee attacks. No running. Nothing. There is a guarantee that 30% of the player population are made up of bots.

review:
Despite trying more or less every other "Battle Royale" on the market over the years, Apex always eluded me, there was always this soft sense of 'bitterness' over the fact that Titanfall 2 was launched in a horrible window and Titanfall 3 as a concept, was completely abandoned, all to pave way for a trend-chasing Battle Royale game instead.

[b]Fast-forward to 2025 and that juvenile bitterness has subsided so, I figured I'd give it a go.[/b]

What I found was no Titanfall 3, but still an incredibly competent and charming FPS, with a host of awesome looking and sounding characters, all diverse in their skill-sets and abilities, with great looking guns and satisfying gun-play. I don't have thousands of hours to fall back on or 'the good old days' glasses to wear. As a new player, I think this is a cracking game and I've enjoyed every match, win-or-lose, frustration or not.

The game is, as expected, heavily monetised and it's been out for quite some time. They also run loot-boxes in the form of Apex packs and have these absolutely ridiculous 'collection events' which could have you spending hundreds of pounds, dollars etc, just to have a chance of getting a unique 'heirloom' relevant to that event. I think it's ridiculous personally.

I also think the experience is brought down by having only three-stacks at maximum. I think quads should definitely be a thing in all honesty, but I don't know how that'd effect team-fight balancing and I'm just a scrub at the end of the day.

Most heroes are locked which, feels weird, but as a new player, that gives the 'spotlight passes' some value. Basically, they're tiny battle pass progression tracks for each character you can pay for. Buying them unlocks the character, a host of cosmetics for that character, a gun cosmetic, some other packs, crafting materials and, if you need help on the battle pass, around 5 or so levels worth of stars, I think. Good for someone new wanting to pad out their cosmetic locker AND unlock heroes, mid-bad value for long term players though I'd say.

Honestly, I thoroughly enjoy this one, probably more so than any other Battle Royale I've played. I jumped into it late, but I'm glad I did, easily a steady game in my live-service rotation now and the only BR title I will play going forward, regardless of updates to other games, or new and shiny BR experiences that may or may not come out.

TL:DR for people with a bit of brain-rot / short attention spans : Game good, not jaded by good ol' days or loads of hours played over the years. Having a good time with it, best BR I've played of the bunch.
name: Apex Legends‚Ñ¢

review:
despite having fantastic movement and gunplay, apex legends unfortunately cant change the fact that it's a battle royale. 

this game feels like an arena shooter that got turbo juiced on movement mechanics and then crammed into a game mode ill suited to the amount of creativity and skill expression it allows for. on top of that it's owned by ea and has some of the most predatory practices around. so despite loving this game, and the fact that it will be in the rotation for me permanently (assuming they dont ruin the movement) I cannot recommend this game whatsoever.

movement mechanics 10/10
gunplay mechanics 9/10
character design 6/10
gamemode 3/10
microtransactions 0/10

review:
You open the game.
Finish a 3000-word essay while it loads the main menu.
You pray they fed the server hamsters today as you queue. You pick Octane cause you like running fast, not cause he's on drugs.
Your teammates pick Caustic and TTV Wraith.
Champion squad is a pred and 2 masters.
Game begins: you sprint juiced up, looting and killing.
You get jumped because footstep audio doesn't exist.
TTV Wraith goes down.
You clutch a 1v3 because Mastiff is balanced. Meanwhile, Caustic sets traps outside zone.
You grab Wraith's banner, try to respawn, but they quit with 0.2s left.
Someone beams you at the beacon, then instantly gets 3rd- partied while a 4th misses every shot.
Predator shows up, wipes the lobby.
Your Caustic dies to zone.
Back at the main menu, a random level 500 is waiting in your
party. You queue again.
Disconnected-hamsters passed out.
Load the game again, cause it's worth the pain just for another glance at Loba's thick ass.

review: Ah yes apex Legends. I know i only have 70 hours on pc but on ps5 and xbox i have together 5k and maybe more hours on this game im a day one player at that too lol. Apex was and is (kinda) fun it depends on what you are looking for its not very new player friendly unless you played apex when it first came out. Movement wise is great best movement from a game. I think what makes this game not fun anymore is skill and PROS and twitch streamers i get everyone wants to be famous and stuff but god. So dont be surprise when you get killed by a TTV or KICK person. I say skill because you got to at least know how to wall jump or bunny hop and i barely know how to which is crazy. BALANCING in this game is just bad they really only listen to pro or base it off of ALGs there will be times when they do listen but thats if the normal people say it and the pros say it too sadly. So when it comes to who they will listen to keep a eye out. MONEY i know its like hitting a dead horse but skins is very expensive for one skin its at least 20 to 30 dollars you can have the skin or the gun they will discount for 5 dollars off lol. Heirlooms i feel like this is the only thing that keep this game alive (kinda) but its bad you have to spend 160 oh wait its 200 or 260 yeah dont get no event with a heirloom. I feel like they should give out at least one time a free heirloom just one just saying man it will bring back some people. i have retired from apex it brings a lot of stress after work and i just want to relax not rage plus my gf and family dont play this anymore btw soloing in this game SUCKS. Overall i give this game a 3 out 5.

review:
Lets talk about apex legends....  This game launched back in February of 2019, and man oh man it was a hit. That being said Respawn did everything in their power to destroy it so lets talk about it.

1. The movement.....
I'm not normally a huge fan of the extreme fast paced movement but Titanfall had it perfect and when Apex Legends came out they nailed perfectly. It felt fun and exciting but now, not so much chief.
You see I'm not sure why they did it but they went and made Apex Legends, Chunky Legends. I'm not sure if this was a community complaint or or a ranked complaint or even Respawn just sippin the juice too hard but this feels horrible now. It just kills the parkour and sprint feature, I shouldn't have to slide down a hill for a boost in speed. 

2. The guns.....
Respawn did this really cool thing where they brought all the guns from Titanfall and just molested them.
You see they went and looked into the fan favorite weapons and nerfed the life out of them to switch up the meta, but the weapons were fine! Honestly this wouldn't be a bad thing if they buffed them after a while but that's just it, they never get buffed back! Every gun feels like a I'm hitting them with with pillows. You're forced to just puke all your ammo out on one guy because every time you do damage he just runs away and shields back up and rinse and repeat until one of you either runs out of shields or ammo. You make a competitive game and then try to hard to make it  "player friendly" and just turned it into a bullet hose arena

3.The characters.
(this one is my personal opinion so feel free to blow past this one) There are so many characters and they cost an arm and a leg to unlock. Half of them are absolutely useless and feel like gimics. The skins are kinda cringe too at times, not all of them but most of them.

4.The Store...
I know the game is free and the store is where they make money but the prices on the items, oh my god.
like 20+ dollars for a majority of the items in the store. It just feels scummy and it's giving wallet reaching big time. Respawn is just becoming activision 2.0.

I think that wraps it up for me. This game used to be such a gem but like all things on earth, aging kills (unless your a lobster) It does feel sad though because this game really speed ran the whole "killing my own community" strat within a year I would say. They already announced that there wasn't gonna be a Titanfall 3 so this was the only brainchild in the works to my knowledge which just feels like the thing they care about is collecting card info now and not the Titanfall arena experience this game is built around. Stay away from this game and let it go peacefully into the night. Lest Respawn does anymore harm before it does.
name: Apex Legends‚Ñ¢

review:
In the first summer of its launch, the game originally drew me in with its story, characters, and universe. It had a gritty and interesting style of storytelling that eventually got me into Titanfall 2 -- now one of my sci-fi story loves. Unfortunately, my love affair with Apex Legends' storytelling and universe has long since been on the decline ever since they've been whittling down their writing team; most of the narrative/writing direction have now left and gone on to other, better prospects. The love that used to go into the community is now nonexistent compared to the days they had a social media/community manager that EA then fired. A lot of characters now fall into the Overwatch trap of getting released constantly and then receiving zero lore/attention.

In terms of technical stuff, the game was buggy in its initial years of launch, and now is *mostly* stable for most people. Unfortunately, it is not optimised for everyone, and I am in that camp. Most days I'm unable to launch this game without opening it 4-5 times. Getting constant lag warnings (literally all the symbols) in most games and on most days, with fibre internet and an all right PC. 

The biggest joke is that I'm still playing this game, but I like shooting things + I hate change and seeking out new media. For anyone looking into something new to get into for the story and lore and community, honestly, just find a different game. It's not getting better from here on out.

review: This game is genuinely the worst game of my life. You can go one single game without playing against people who are the highest rank in the game or ALGS pros. There is not a single reason why someone who has never been above platinum 2 can get into a game with someone who has played in official tournaments. Eventually me and my friend were tired of it and decided to play on alt accounts to hopefully not play against highest rank people, but 3 games in and we were no match for the top 500. I believe this is a result of the poor decisions made by Respawn. They have done nothing but absolutely ruin their game. Marksmen rifles have the highest fastest TTK in the game, the playable character made around movement has the least movement in the game, duos has half the players in it and half the map already covered by zone, and the list goes on. It even got to the point that some pros have quit. The player count is at an all time low for a reason. Today it took me over 8 minutes for me to get into a game, just for it to end in 2 minutes because one of the top 500 players in the world absolutely desecrated me. At this point I cant even accidentally have fun in this game. If your ever even thinking about trying this game, I implore you not to.

review:
ive played this game way too much on my xbox (like over a thousand hours) and I have a bit to say (havent played the game in a year but god knows respawn didnt fix shit)

The matchmaking is horribly unfair, putting me in lobbies with either people who I wipe out easily or putting me in lobbies with preds that somehow smelled worse than me.
The ranked system also sucks. Placement is waaaay above getting kills, so final zone will tend to have like 10 teams in it all sitting in corners of the zone trying to widdle the other teams down. This made the grind so incredibly boring, and for a game that has such great movement, it's a waste that half the game in ranked is spent standing in a corner.
It also just has the curse of shitty random teammates, so if you REALLY want to download this game in the big 25, get 2 others to play with you.

All in all, go play Titanfall 2, this was NOT the Titanfall 3 I wanted :(

review:
üí•üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è BROOO APEX LEGENDS ITU ROYALE PALING CEPAT, PALING CHAOTIC, DAN PALING STYLISH! üí•

Bayangin lo dilempar ke arena futuristik, 60 orang saling bunuh demi jadi yang terakhir berdiri. Tapi bedanya, ini bukan battle royale biasa, ini parkour, skill, dan teamwork dalam satu paket gila!

‚ö° Gameplay? FUSION ANTARA SPEED & STRATEGY!
Lo bisa sliding ngebut di lereng, zipline dari atap ke atap, trus tiba-tiba flank musuh dari arah nggak terduga. Setiap karakter punya skill unik dari healer, trap master, sampe teleport ninja. Lo nggak cuma nembak, tapi juga ngerencanain tiap langkah kayak taktik perang modern.

üî´ Gunplay-nya? CLEAN BANGET.
Recoil-nya terasa realistis, tiap senjata punya feel dan suara khas. Dari Wingman yang satisfying banget pas kena headshot, sampe R-99 yang literally nyemprot peluru kayak air mancur.

ü§ù SQUAD PLAY = INTI SEGALANYA.
Main sendiri sih bisa, tapi Apex itu hidup dari kerjasama tim. Lo bakal saling cover, ping lokasi musuh, revive temen di tengah hujan peluru, dan panik bareng pas ring udah nutup. Komunikasi di sini tuh hal paling penting dan paling chaos juga. üòÇ

üé® VISUAL & MAP? BERASA FUTURISTIK TAPI HIDUP.
Dari gurun Kings Canyon sampe kota neon di Olympus, semua map-nya detail banget. Warna vibrant, efek ability keren, dan design karakternya bergaya sci-fi yang beda banget dari battle royale lain.

üéµ AUDIO = CLUTCH MOMENT MAKER.
Suara langkah musuh, zipline, atau ultimate Horizon yang mulai aktif, semuanya bisa jadi bedain hidup dan mati. Headset wajib, bro.

üåü Rating: 9/10
Apex Legends = battle royale buat lo yang suka adrenalin tinggi, teamwork solid, dan gameplay secepat kilat. Gue balik dulu, masih ada squad yang nge-hold high ground. Wish me luck, bro. Octane gue udah siap ngebut! üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüí®üí•

review:
As before this game I played Titanfall 2 and Call of Duty, I will try to make this comparison based on those.

This is a unique game, meaning if you are the average cod playing Joe, u won't just be a god here with good aims. The healing system is slower than in cod, so you cant just fully reheal mid fight, here u need to have an edge. Maps are more punishing meaning, there is always cover, but there are massive walls on every map so u need to be careful where u rotate otherwise u are going to be stuck outside. Weapons are solid, not huge recoil, its learnable. Movement is interesting, because at first it feels extremely rigid, then when u learn what to do and how, it can be really fast and fluid. 

What I want to say: this is a skill needed game, I think more than cod. Plus in its current state it is kinda abandoned by devs, but it runs, finds matches fast and that is about enough.

review:
Apex Legends stands out as one of the best battle royale games ever made, combining fast-paced gunplay, smooth movement, and unique Legends that keep every match fresh and exciting. The teamwork-focused gameplay and constant updates make it incredibly replayable, and Respawn‚Äôs attention to detail shines through in every aspect of the game.

However, the experience is sometimes held back by persistent server issues, including lag and connection drops, especially frustrating since there are still no dedicated servers in Africa. Despite these setbacks, Apex Legends remains a thrilling, well-designed shooter that rewards skill, strategy, and communication.

Verdict: A top-tier battle royale with unmatched gameplay ‚Äî if only the servers could keep up. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚òÜ

review: I was there when the game first came out. I was there in the era of Titanfall 1 and then Titanfall 2. And now i came back eager to see where the franchice has gone.  The first thing i am meet with is an abundance of game modes, heroes, abilities, in match hero uppgrades, generic boring maps and for some reason they have added giant banners telling the players where everything is and even what kind of ammo you can find at this location??? I miss the old kings canyon and the old haloween event. It was simple and fun.
name: Apex Legends‚Ñ¢

review:
If you want a game where every player you come across is at the highest rank 24/7 or the game is so hell bent on having a new meta that 2 characters are beyond broken and a weapon or two is so overpowered if you don't have it you are guaranteed to lose, welcome to this piece of shite. No matter your rank you will play against the second highest rank 80% of the time. Skill based matchmaking? You mean pretending your skill is so high you should only play against the best is what I was hoping you wanted. It's nice to watch videos on how to get better with this game, since the skill ceiling is so high you can't even see it, and you start getting a hang of how to play, and then the up and coming pro teams laser you from the other side of a poi and some how teleports behind you and infront of you simultaneously. You figure it's a fluke and after 5 hours of this ragebait simulator, you realize this is every game.

How about the meta and legends and loot pool. As another reviewer said, it's like they threw darts on a board and picked what they hit. The most random legends are buffed to god status and random ones are nerfed so much their pick rate hits zero. The unfortunate issue with the legends is that most players like only a few gameplay types so nearly half of the legends don't get much use. Instead of reworking these legends, EA decides to let them be or do the aforementioned buffing/nerfing at insane levels. We don't need a new meta based solely on the use of one legend. Games with win conditions are not fun at all. You don't have the latest legend that go so buffed they make you want to leave the match before you get obliterated? Guess you need to get better and try again.

The guns aren't any better. EA takes out random weapons from the loot pool, and will redesign a gun or two and make them so powerful they become win conditions. They also refuse to balance anything. Both the legends and guns are not balanced to any extent. Some guns become crutches, others win conditions, and some are so bad most people refuse to pick them up even if they need a gun. The devs really don't give a fart about making the game balanced or really interesting. Content only comes from these legend and gun changes. I guess if you like gambling and maxing out credit cards then there might be content for you. Pixels are worth $360 - $1000 trust me. When the game shuts down you've lost so much money you want to cry but at least you had fun doing it.
name: Apex Legends‚Ñ¢

review:
If you are okay with: 

1.A matchmaking system that favors the high rank over the low rank ( the Preds are put into lower ranks to have an advantage ) 
2.Micro-transactions that never stay micro cosmetics that costs a shit ton of money an RNG system that gives you literally crap and one golden pack once in a blue moon with a golden banner or hologram.
3.Getting one clipped by cheaters that make no sound not because of the cheat but because of the fact that the sound fucking sucks in this game.
4.Cheaters cheaters cheaters cheaters cheaters .... it is insane how many cheaters are in this game it is starting to look like warzone.
5. the server sucks it is insane how much money people spend on this game but they still wont fix a damn thing.

6. you will be addicted to the feeling of winning a battle and you will be hooked up to that feeling because the algorithm is doing it on purpose to keep you as a Cog in the player count machine.


If you are okay with the points mentioned above then download the game and play it, it is true that there is no other game like apex legends with its unique movement, but at the same time there isnt any other game with the same amount of BUGS microtransactions Expensive events more than 20 Mythic skins obtainable only and only after opening 500 packs. 

After getting pressed by the south korean government EA released the exact percentage of the probability of getting heirloom shards , before and even now the game mentioned that it was >1% 

The exact number is 0.045%, Game made by jews so expect to be milked and sucked dry of your bones.

review:
Reached 5555.5 hours of Apex Legends on Steam, and I also played some good amount on console, mobile and EA app. 

So far I have 0.5 KD, which grows roughly by 0.1 each 1000 hours I play. I started S10 on PC, then played on XBOX and got Diamond on S12, then switched back to PC and got Plat same Season, and couldn't get past Gold next one. 

Almost completely didn't play S14, because I played Apex mobile, and got there Master on both First Person and Third Person modes. It was infested with PC players on emulators, speed hackers, etc. 

As for maps, I experienced first version of Worlds Edge and Kings Canyon for the first time, as I started Apex late. I tried Apex for very first time on S5, on console, played a little, but at that time, my main game was Fortnite. 

I played Fortnite about 1.9K hours, about two years, which I also played late - since Season X, and reason I seriously started Apex, was because Fortnite pissed me off on about Chapter 3... 

At first I liked it, but then I just rage quit it, since Spiderman gloves allowed people just to run away so fast, and also run up to you from nowhere. And they kept adding similar non-stop grapplers after that too. 

Plus I aslo encountered cheaters, and they also went live on Tik Tok spinning around their axis, one shotting people through terrain, teleporting accross the map... 

I've seen also Apex cheaters streaming about that time, with multicolored lines pointing to each player... But somehow I sticked to Apex. That's my comfort game, where I get my neurodivergent AuDHD mind enough of novelty each game, and not so much change, at the same time, as I play the same game, which thankfully doesn't change so much season to season, as Fortnite. 

Thank you for being my main game (95% of my gaming) for last four years! 

If I could ask something, I'd love to have Apex music from all seasons. You can add it on shop. Sure, I can play them on YouTube, but I love how music is built for game, when there is loading it's one theme, when you start drop, it plays main part, and when you win, it's also different. 

Thank you Respawn team for making this game cool and awesome! 

P.S. I have also played around with Unreal Engine 5, and would be honored to create some level design/map design together with you, if you consider my time spent in game and passion for it would help.

review:
The Ultimate Apex Legends Review (2025 Edition)

Introduction

Apex Legends, Respawn Entertainment's free-to-play battle royale, has evolved significantly since its 2019 debut. As of late 2025, the game continues to captivate players with its dynamic gameplay, diverse roster of Legends, and ever-evolving content. However, with its complexity and competitive nature, questions arise about its suitability for younger audiences.

Gameplay and Mechanics

Apex Legends distinguishes itself with its unique blend of fast-paced combat, strategic team play, and hero-based abilities. Players select from a roster of Legends, each with distinct skills that influence team dynamics and strategy. The game's movement system, including sliding, climbing, and ziplining, offers fluid and responsive controls, enhancing player immersion.

The introduction of the "Wildcard" mode in Season 26 allows players to stack Legends, creating opportunities for innovative strategies and dynamic gameplay. Additionally, the game's seasonal updates, such as the Prodigy season, introduce new characters and balance changes to keep the gameplay fresh and engaging.

Graphics and Audio

Apex Legends features a stylized art direction with vibrant environments and detailed character models. While the visuals are appealing, some players have reported issues with the game's audio, particularly regarding sound cues and spatial awareness, which can impact the overall experience. Despite these concerns, the game's visual design remains a strong point.

Community and Social Interaction

The game's online multiplayer nature fosters a strong community, with players collaborating in teams to achieve victory. However, this also exposes players to potential negative interactions, such as toxic behavior and harassment. While the game includes features like voice chat and team communication, it's essential for players to be aware of the social dynamics and take precautions when engaging with others online.

Is Apex Legends Suitable for Kids?

Apex Legends is rated "T for Teen" by the ESRB, indicating it's appropriate for players aged 13 and older. The game includes content descriptors for blood, violence, and interactive elements, such as online communication and in-game purchases. While the violence is stylized and not overly graphic, the game's competitive nature and online interactions may not be suitable for younger children.

Parents should consider the game's content and the potential for exposure to online interactions when determining if it's appropriate for their children. It's advisable to monitor gameplay and set appropriate boundaries to ensure a positive gaming experience.

Conclusion

Apex Legends remains a premier choice for players seeking a competitive and engaging battle royale experience. Its unique gameplay mechanics, diverse Legends, and regular content updates keep the game fresh and exciting. However, its complexity and online nature necessitate consideration regarding its suitability for younger audiences. Parents should assess the game's content and social interactions to determine its appropriateness for their children.

News Highlights

Wildcard Mode Introduced: Season 26 introduces the "Wildcard" mode, allowing players to stack Legends and engage in fast-paced, high-intensity matches. This mode includes unique features like the "Wildcards" system, offering temporary abilities and strategic advantages. 
-Polygon

ALGS Year 5 Developments: The 2025 Apex Legends Global Series (ALGS) introduces a Legend BAN system and a Point-of-Interest drafting system, enhancing the competitive landscape. The season culminated in the ALGS Open in New Orleans, where Team Falcons emerged victorious. 
-Wikipedia

Revenant Temporarily Disabled: Due to a game-breaking glitch, the character Revenant has been temporarily disabled across all game modes. Respawn Entertainment is addressing the issue to maintain gameplay integrity. 
-The Times of India

Audio Issues Persist: Despite ongoing updates, some players report persistent audio issues affecting gameplay, particularly regarding sound cues and spatial awareness. 
-EA Forums

Final Verdict

Apex Legends continues to be a top-tier battle royale game, offering a blend of strategic depth and fast-paced action. While it provides an engaging experience for players aged 13 and above, its complexity and online interactions may not be suitable for younger audiences. Parents should consider the game's content and social dynamics when determining its appropriateness for their children.

review:
TL;DR - Apex Legends is fun and rewarding but difficult and frustrating. Worth it, but only to a certain point

Apex Legends is a game that can be so much fun, but it has one of the highest skill curves of any competitive shooter I have played. Its predecessor TItanfall, especially Titanfall 2, is one of the best shooters and stories of all time. 
Respawn Entertainment makes great games, but with EA having so many transactions for cosmetics, their servers being garbage, and the high skill gap, you have to spend so so so many hours to get very good at the game. Frankly, I don't want to spend all my time playing one game. I have more important things in my life than playing a video game. I say go back to Titallfall. We all want Titanfall 3!

review:
Game was great on launch one of the best launches of any game in fact.  Lots of stuff was OP and broken, but it was super fun.  EA buys it and runs micro transactions up the a** and very lackluster battle pass where every second "award" was a level badge... like who is gonna put they are level 4 battle pass on their character???? UI is not very intuitive and is clunky with sub menus to get where you need but I guess with enough time you memorize where things are. 

gun play and movement are what keeps this game afloat.  Most things are polished at this point and are pretty smooth.  But the next big battle royal with good movement and gun play will kill this game and BF6 will prob do this when they make their BR.

And who wants your DEI stuff crammed down our throats?? Just make a game where you shoot people and stay out of performative character design, no one wants that esp the voice lines... its such a turn off.  

This game has slowly been dying and getting worse and worse as the years go on, they forgot they are supposed to just make a good FPS BR.  

There is a reason why EA is the worst gaming company and everyone knows it. Go woke, go broke...I guess thats why the Saudis bought them.

review:
üí• Apex Legends (2025) Review ‚Äî The King Still Reigns üëë

Even after six years, Apex Legends proves why it‚Äôs still one of the best live-service shooters on the planet. Respawn has somehow kept that signature adrenaline-fueled magic alive ‚Äî slick gunplay, iconic Legends, and world-class movement that most competitors still can‚Äôt touch.

Season after season, Apex feels like a masterclass in balance between chaos and control. The moment you slide into a gunfight, zipline across a rooftop, or clutch a 1v3 with the perfect grenade ‚Äî it just clicks. The rhythm, the sound design, the smoothness‚Ä¶ there‚Äôs still nothing quite like it. üéØ

2025‚Äôs new content cycle has been surprisingly generous too. From the Wildcard events to legend reworks that actually feel impactful, Respawn is listening again ‚Äî and it shows. Server stability, hit detection, and ranked pacing all feel tighter than they‚Äôve been in years.

And let‚Äôs be honest ‚Äî no other battle royale has characters this stylish or lore this rich. Each Legend feels alive, with personality oozing out of every animation and voice line. Whether you main Wraith, Catalyst, or the latest powerhouse, there‚Äôs always a reason to jump back in.

Apex in 2025 isn‚Äôt just surviving ‚Äî it‚Äôs thriving. The competition keeps trying to copy its DNA, but Apex Legends still wears the crown. üëëüî•

Verdict: 9.5 / 10
Apex Legends remains the GOAT of movement shooters ‚Äî fast, beautiful, and endlessly fun. Long live the arena. üíÄüí´

review:
This game is utterly terrible. The developers evidently show no interest for the player community. Each update somehow manages to break the game further. They attempt to "balance" elements with no logical reasoning. It seems as if they randomly throw darts at a board and label it as patch notes. The map sometimes feels like it has been generated by an AI. As for the servers? They are absolutely awful. There is lag, persistent instability, and frequently, players are kicked from matches mid game which happened to me a few times.

Now about their so called "updates." They are merely pretexts to force more overpriced cosmetics onto the player base. It is absurd. They buff a character like Mad Maggie, conveniently launching a flashy new skin for her and then exploit it while players rush to purchase it. The following season, the cycle repeats with another character. It is shameless.

Since the last update where they completely ruined how players drop into the map, the game‚Äôs been a total disaster. Now you don‚Äôt even get to choose you‚Äôre just thrown into some "random" pre-selected spot, like it or not. Wonder why I marked out random? Because almost always it's not even random I noticed how you basically always drop at the same 2-3 places even tho there's like 10 others. And the best part? You constantly get the ‚ÄúYou are being invaded‚Äù message even when literally no one is dropping near you. It‚Äôs been like this since the start of the update, and they haven‚Äôt fixed it, mentioned it, or even acknowledged it. Just another perfect example of how little the devs actually care about the game or its players.

Then they have recently transformed the Peacekeeper which was once a rare and powerful airdrop weapon into a standard firearm that pretty much wasn't nerfed at all. Now, every match feels identical. The same broken weapons the same two or three characters that are being played while all the other characters are not being touched at all. The developers appear to be either inactive or entirely absent. This game has devolved into monotonous chaos. Unstable and entirely motivated by greed.

review:
Kinda fun. 75gb is a bit much for something so simple and the sweats are annoying but eh

Anyway I'm writing this review more to talk about something weird that happened after I installed this. When I was like fourteen I played this for a dozen or so hours on an Xbox one and got some levels and experience and all that. I promptly forgot about the game until I decided to try it again a few months ago to play it with someone. (Note that I have never put Apex on my PC before.)

After the install and setup process, which was done entirely with me connected to a VPN, I was greeted with an account that was already level thirteen. I wasn't prompted to sign in or anything like that beforehand. I already had skins from season two or three for some weapons and some skins for a few of the operators.

Then I realized, the game knew it was me and put me in my old account?? (I think??) I played a few matches after that point and eventually ran into one other person who said he had a similar experience.

No clue what causes this but there's only so many possibilities here. Wtf EA???

review:
This game is not free. It costs your sanity, your patience, and whatever scraps of joy you had left after Season 3.

Apex Legends is a fast-paced, team-based battle royale where communication is key. This is great, because my random teammates are usually mute philosophers or 12-year-olds screaming in a dialect not known to mankind.

I land, I loot, I get third-partied within 45 seconds by a squad using every meta gun Respawn forgot to nerf. Then I get to watch my teammate crouch-walk around the edge of the zone with four Mozambiques and the game sense of a toaster.

And the ranked system? It‚Äôs a social experiment designed to test how many hours a human being can waste while slowly being demoted by people playing like NPCs with a ping of 900.

Movement? Amazing.
Gunplay? Slick.
Servers? Held together by chewing gum and hope.
Cheaters? Somewhere between "occasional nuisance" and "entire population of the match."

I genuinely hate how fun this game could be if it didn‚Äôt actively try to ruin my life every time I boot it up. Apex is like a toxic ex who shows up in your dreams to remind you of the good times... right before pushing you off a cliff.
name: Apex Legends‚Ñ¢

review:
Jumping into Apex Legends is like signing up for a high-speed chaos party‚Äîexcept half your team forgets how to shoot, and the other half insists on teabagging after every kill. The legends are cool, the weapons are deadly, and the drop spots are basically "run for your life" zones.

Expect fast-paced battles, wild abilities, and a lot of respawns (because you‚Äôll definitely get knocked down‚Ä¶ a lot).

10/10 would get obliterated and blame my teammates again.
name: Apex Legends‚Ñ¢
